alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 19 at 11:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: Periods of Heavy Rainfall have 15 to 30 Percent Probability of Occurring Sunday into Monday With Potential Flooding Impacts to Burn Scars and Flood Prone Areas. Hurricane Hilary will move across the Great Basin into southwestern Montana bringing lots of atmospheric moisture to the region for tomorrow into Monday. Initial bands of rain will be periodically heavy, with rainfall rates at higher terrain locations in Northern Beaverhead County being between 0.25 to 0.5 inch per hour. Rainfall becomes lighter through the overnight period Sunday, with another band of heavy rainfall having 15 to 30 percent probability of developing again Monday morning. Flood prone areas such as burn scars and poor drainage locations, will have a greater risk of mudslides, falling rock, and flooding impacts. The forecast for the remnants of this hurricanes track and strength will influence the hydrologic impacts, with fluctuation in rainfall amounts and its impacts at this forecast period remain uncertain for higher elevations.
